Upload YTPlayer.swf to your server, then use the following HTML (where tBb4cjjj1gI is the !YouTube video's ID):

{{{
<object width="425" height="344" classid="clsid:d27cdb6e-ae6d-11cf-96b8-444553540000" codebase="https://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=9,0,0,0">
	<param name="movie" value="YTPlayer.swf?vidId=tBb4cjjj1gI" />
	<param name="allowFullScreen" value="true" />
	<param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always" />
	<embed src="hYTPlayer.swf?vidId=tBb4cjjj1gI" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true" width="425" height="344"></embed>
</object>
}}}

_(Note that the codebase must begin with https.)_

The original FLA, YTPlayer.fla, is also included for reference.
